line.en: That night, a few days had passed since she'd\ngiven me that vague answer, and summer vacation\nhad started.
I was still active in the club, but I never saw\nAsa there.

Ever since then, Asa never showed her face around
the club. She just kept herself holed up in her
room. The situation did nothing to boost our
morale.
As for me, I worried about it every waking moment\nof every day.
...Impossible. I can't choose either one of them.
The Asa who thinks this highly of me.
It's not so easy to just ignore Asa's feelings. I\njust can't.
It's just as impossible to try to pretend I don't\nknow how Yoru feels.
Yoru had been praying that her sister's love\nwould triumph, so much so that she had smothered\nher own feelings to death.
'...I won't accept you dumping my sister.'
Yoru was always one step ahead of her sister.
And the reason why Yoru did this kind of thing\nwould be because she understood the hopeless\nsituation...
But no, that's not my main issue.
But the me right now simply can't just ditch Asa,\neither. I've become incredibly indecisive.
Asa and Yoru are both really important to me.
It's not like I can just choose one of them.
If I do, there's a chance that it'll end up\ncreating a rift between the two of them.
'I guess you've come up with an answer.'
She asks that before I even say anything. She's\nreally observant.
'...Yeah. Well, then...'
It took a lot of courage to say something like\nthat.
If I actually came out with it, Yoru might have\nended up hating me - it was that kind of thing.
But...
'...I'm sorry.'
That was it, I had to say it.
I should have told her properly.
'...Well, I guess I expected it.'
I was a little surprised that Yoru took it so\neasily.
I mean, it seemed like she was totally ready for\nit.
My words, my answer...
'You're responding based on my sister's feelings,\nthat's really nice.'
'You think so...'
'I was thinking of turning down Asa's\nconfession.'
Of course, it seemed Yoru was a little surprised\nby this.
'Wh-, what are you talking about?! She's really\nbetter than you deserve, she's such a... and you\njust...'
'...I'm sorry, I know it's true, but...'
'I'm really sorry.'
'I know... I mean, it's not as if you have to\nchoose one of us...'
'I'm sorry. For some reason, I said something\nreally messed up.'
She looks really miserable, and apologizes.
She's probably embarassed about how upset she'd\nbecome.
'...Is there someone that you like?'
It was a hard question to answer.
Someone I like...
There was someone that fit the bill, but...
'Let's see... Well, I guess I don't really know.'
I wasn't very straight with her.
I still didn't really know how I felt, at that\npoint. I had this feeling I liked both of them,\nbut that was...
'Well, neither of us are really in your league.\nThat's just how it is. It's fine.'
'That's a mean way to put it.'
'I'm just being honest.'
'Sorry. I don't really have time to tell you\neverything now, but I just feel like I don't have\nanything to hold on to.'
'But anyway, I guess I chose to have it this\nway.'
I couldn't explain.
I thought it would be best to just avoid the\nissue.
'...I understand.'
Yoru gave a little nod as if she was agreeing to\nsomething. Then:
'Why don't you go blow her off, too.'
She said it with such a strange smile on her\nface.
'Yoru...'
That Yoru, she's really tough. I thought she was\nnice.
...That's why I had that painful tightness in my\nchest
'Yes?'
'It's me, can I come in?'
'Ummm... Sure!'
After I entered her room, Asa became fidgety, and\nshe couldn't seem to settle down.
'I, uh, I'm sorry about the other day.'
'No, no, I'm the one who should...'
No matter what, it was going to be awkward for\nAsa to speak to me. She averted her eyes while\nshe spoke.
'Um, Aoi?'
'...Yeah?'
'I understand. Before you tell me anything, I\njust want you to know, I already understand.'
'The club, the glider, everything. I'm always\nlooking for something steady and solid.'
'So this time, I just got all wrapped up in you.'
Everything was going all wrong. I should have\nspoken up first. I couldn't let Asa say any more\nthan this.
I was caught totally off guard, and I ended up\nletting Asa break the bad news to me.
That was all wrong.
'I've been thinking hard about it, trying to come\nup with my own answer. So...'
'I'm sorry. I can't really reciprocate your\nfeelings.'
I ended up hurting Asa, too.
I knew that's how it had to be, but it still\nhurt.
I wondered why the two of them were both so\ndesperate to be with me.
No, it wasn't the time to think about that.
I had to tell her properly.
'I apologized to Yoru, too.'
'Actually, Yoru confessed to me later that day.\nSo I apologized.'
'Yoru was glad too, but I didn't know how to\nhandle it.'
'That's why I feel so bad. I'm sorry.'
'Why... is that...?'
In a raspy tone, Asa gave voice to her doubts.
'Why? Yoru is such a nice girl! Didn't you say so\nyourself? She's cool. So why, then?!...'
'I don't think of her like that.'
'Tssss...'
I told her clearly, straight up.
I didn't think of her like that.
'Because I'm not really interested in either of\nyou.'
I didn't need to say anything else.
That was all there was to it.
'So, I'm sorry.'
'...That's a lie.'
'What?'
'I know, I've always paid attention to people's\nfaces. I've lived a little... and that's how I\nknow.'
'You're lying.'
'...What?'
When I heard her say that, it was as if she was\npeering right into my heart.
'Because you're not the kind of person that\nnormally glances away with that guilty look when\nyou talk.'
'Oh... hmmm...'
I, uh.
I didn't mean to, I just did it unconsciously.
'You're always so confident, so fun and\nhard-working, so quit making that pathetic face!'
'That face is just...'
I forgot.
Asa was always extremely sensitive to what was\ngoing on around her, to people's gestures.
She's the type of girl who's careful regarding\nthe subtleties of this sort of sensitive person.
'Even if you choose Yoru over me, I won't hold it\nagainst her!'
'Sure, I might get a little bummed out over it,\nbut I guess that's just how it is.'
'No, you're wrong, Asa. That's not how it is...'
'Please, just go away!'
'Please.'
I wanted to clear things up. I wanted to explain.
But, I just couldn't. There was nothing else I\ncould do.
In fact, everything that Asa said was completely\ntrue.
She was exactly right. It was true that things\nwere hopeless.
There was nothing I could do except leave without\nsaying a word.
...I failed.
I just lay down on my bed, staring at the\nceiling, reflecting on the big mistake I'd just\nmade.
Even though I hadn't wanted to hurt Asa.
If I had just clearly chosen to like one or the\nother, I probably would have still ended up\nhurting the other one.
When I look at it like this, I understand far too\nmuch.
I was really hung up on both Asa and Yoru. I\nmean, that's how I felt.
I would have called that woozy sentimental love,\nbut I would probably end up offending someone.
But...
After all, both of them...
...The next morning.
'Asa's fever still isn't going down?'

'For a while it seemed to be getting better, but
then it came back. So it looks like she'll skip
the club activity today. She probably won't eat
breakfast.'
Asa didn't show up at breakfast.
It seems like her condition is deteriorating.
They made a meal for her before we knew she was\nsick, but it was left on the table untouched.
Anyway, before we start eating we can wrap it up\nand put it in the fridge.
'Uh... did something happen?'
Kanako was coming closer, so I whispered.
'What? Umm... Yeah... What happened was...'

'So Aoi, you haven't been able to get a grip all
morning. You couldn't even hold your chopsticks
properly when we were eating, and then just as I
was noticing that, Asa started to clear the
table... That's weird.'
'Ah, th- that's true, isn't it?'
'You know, I think something must have happened.\nLook, that's strange too.'
Yoru just kept silently eating.
The whole time, she had an permanent scowl on her\nface.
'...Did you do something to make someone mad?'
'No... that...'
I did.
I just couldn't bring myself to turn her down\ndirectly.
I had been planning to turn her down, so I\nfigured it would turn out like this, maybe it's\nno problem.
Maybe it would have been better if I just\nfinished things off with her still\nmisunderstanding.
But...
I just kept thinking about it all night last\nnight.
Just circling round and round through the\nlabyrinth of my thoughts. But I couldn't find any\nanswers.
Well, for now let's just ask Yoru how Asa was\ndoing last night.
Yoru started to talk before I got a chance.
'I'm sorry.'
And she even apologized.
'What? What? Why are you apologizing? I should be\nthe one apologizing here.'
'Why would you apologize?'
'Well, you know, you were upset that I didn't\nturn down Asa more directly...'
'...What? You didn't turn her down.'
'No, no, I did, but... for some reason it just\nleft me with a bad aftertaste...'
'I was just annoyed with my sister, not with\nyou.'
'Ah, really?'
I was a little taken aback by Yoru's abrupt\nrevelation.
Because I thought that she was angry with me for\nhurting Asa.
I thought she was mad that I didn't turn her down\ndirectly.
'She said something I really didn't understand,\nand she's closed herself off like a child...\nThat's why I'm upset.'
'Said something you don't understand...?'
'Yes.'
'Then, when she came back to the room she was\nreally depressed. So, I tried to cheer her up.'
'She was really depressed because you turned her\ndown, that's why I tried to cheer her up...\nbut...'
'She said that it wasn't really the shock of\ngetting rejected. So I asked her, 'If it's not\nthat, then what is it?' but she just apologized.'
'Apologized...'
Of course, Asa misunderstood. She thought that I\nwas trying to keep my distance from her, so I\ncould be with Yoru.
She was pretty close, but still off the mark.
But there was no way to explain it to her. It was\na tricky situation.
'This morning was the same. She probably doesn't\neven have a fever now. Seems like she just wants\nto hole herself up indoors.'
'Yeah, that's probably true...'
I understood. Of course, she didn't have a fever\nat all.
'...I guess you told her about me.'
'Yeah. I told her that I turned you down first. I\napologized to her too, on top of that.'
'I don't know what you told her exactly, but I\nthink maybe she misunderstood.'
'She's just trying to hurt herself, because she\ndoesn't think that you really turned me down.'
Misunderstood.
Of course she did.
But to just sum it up with the word\n'misunderstood' didn't really take everything\ninto account.
'My sister is a little too subservient. So that's\nwhy... why she... misunderstood...'
'She isn't thinking about you. She's just\nthinking about herself. She's really selfish like\nthat.'
'That's why she's so upset.'
I wondered how I had failed so miserably.
Even though I had only turned them down because I\ndidn't want to see them get upset with one\nanother.
In the end that's exactly what happened.
How could I have been so stupid?
'It's alright, I'm just going to leave her\nalone.'
'Huh?'
'I never really thought she could be so selfish.\nI'm not going to have anything to do with her\nuntil she cools down a bit.'
No, I had to tell her.
If I didn't, then it would be my fault when\nthings got weird between the two of them.
Things were already too messed up as they were.
'I'm sorry, I was wrong.'
'What?'
'I lied.'
'You lied?'
'Anyway, we can talk about it on the way to\nschool.'
We walked along silently, side-by-side.
I felt like Yoru was waiting for me to say\nsomething.
It was tricky. It was hard to get the words out\nof my mouth.
But I had to say something.
'I, uh, I like you.'
'What...!'
'But you know, I like Asa too.'
'That's... that's, uh...!?'
I made up my mind to tell her.
I realized that I had to tell her.
'But I knew you wouldn't put up with that... so,\nI just made up my mind to apologize to both of\nyou.'
'That's why I refused both of your feelings'. But\nAsa must have seen through it.'
'Yeah...'
Yoru's lips were quivering.
I suppose that's natural.
But, I guess what I was saying was selfish too,\nin the end.
Then, unexpectedly:
'Umm, so you mean... you like me too?'
'Yes.'
'And my sister?'
'I guess so.'
I just answered honestly.
Yoru looked confused, and her eyes bobbed back\nand forth.
Like she had absolutely no idea how to respond.
'I guess that's just how you are, kind of weird\nin many ways.'
'...I realize that, and I'm sorry.'
I guess if I said that, I really didn't realize\nwhat was going on.
But there was nothing I could do.
It wasn't like I was unable to decide. The fact\nwas, I wanted both of them.
I liked them both so much that there was no way\nto compare them.
'I mean really, I'm sorry...'
'I tried to trick you too, and... I'm really,\nreally sorry about that.'
'But, I think it was her fault.'
'...What?'
'You know, I'm kind of dense when it comes to\ndealing with people other than my sister, so I\nhad no idea that you were lying.'
'Ultimately, Asa is just ignoring your concerns.\nI mean, isn't she just deliberately deluding\nherself?'
'Well, I guess so, but...'
'So, it's clearly her own fault.'
Yoru just laid everything out in her usual\nno-nonsense tone.
'But, it was my deception that provided the\nchance for her...'
'So you turned us down because you like both of\nus. You can't say something like that, normally.'
'It's such a turn off.'
'It's not possible, your heart will split before\nwe even start dating. No. Normally, it doesn't\nhappen that way.'
No. I didn't think so either.
But, in this case, that's how it was. There was\nnothing I could do about it.
'That's why I doubted you. Asa was completely to\nblame in every respect for being so selfish and\nparanoid.'
'You shouldn't get all worked up about it.'
Yoru...
After hearing what Yoru had to say, I did feel\never so slightly relieved.
But...
'You can say that, but it's still my fault. And\nbesides, just leaving Asa all alone like that...'
'That will just be like fanning the flames.\nDefinitely.'
'Huh?'
'You're so nice. But, in this kind of situation\nyou can't be nice.'

'Girls are the kind of creatures who are easily
spoiled if you are too nice to them. They will
come to depend on your kindness, and then they
start to act like selfish little brats.'
'In these kinds of situations you just have to\npull away. You turned her down, so you've got to\nbe prepared to be hated.'
'But you aren't prepared to be hated by anyone.'
Prepared... to be hated.
She was definitely right about that.
'...Yeah, I'm sorry.'
'I'll handle it somehow.'
'I'm just going to ask one more thing, Aoi. You\nare absolutely certain that you like me and my\nsister?'
'Um, yeah.'
'Well, that's okay then.'
'I'll handle it somehow.'
She said she was going to handle it, but I\nwondered what exactly she intended to handle.
I asked her, but she wouldn't answer me.
'Oh, you're here too!'
'Hey, c'mon Aoi! I can't believe you were just\nwalking to school with Yoru, like it was\nnothing!'
'Oh. Ageha and Kotori.'
'Not just, 'Oh!' You won't be seeing me around\nanymore after I go to Flying Fish Manor!''
'I said that I would be coming along with\neverybody. That's why Ageha made a special trip\nto the dorm to see me.'
Come to think of it, it was true.

I wanted to talk with Yoru one on one, but
somehow after we stepped out of the dorm we ended
up saying that we would go to school along with
everybody else.
'Aoi's really cold-hearted, huh?'
'I wonder why he didn't wait for us...?'
'I'm really sorry. There's something I want to\ntalk to Asa about, you guys go ahead.'
'You've been sneaking around all morning. That's\na little dubious too. What are you guys talking\nabout?'
'Well, that's kinda...'
'After that, Asa finally perked up and came out.'
'...What? Really?'
Asa?
'Yeah, she came with us on the way to school.'
'Kana went to her room to see how she was, and\nshe seemed to be doing much better, so she came\non out.'
'And she came along with us to school.'
'Kanako...'
'Aoi.'
Just as we were talking, Kanako appeared.
'Oh, Kanako, about Asa...'
'I came to tell you, but I want to ask Kotori and\nAgeha about it.'
'Yes. So, uh... I guess it wasn't a cold, was\nit?'
'Yeah, guess not. She was just trying to play\nhooky, but I brought her along.'
'Brought her along...'
'Playing hooky is no good.'
'When I went to her room she was all worried\nabout going to school. She even changed into her\nuniform.'
'Asa was going to come to school?'
'She looked like she couldn't decide. So I just\ninvited her. I told her if she couldn't decide\nshe should just come along.'
'...Is that right?'
I suppose it was painful for her to come face to\nface with me. That's why she didn't come down\nthat morning.
It wasn't that she didn't want to go to school,\njust that it was hard for her to go with us...
'I'm sorry, I'm just so spineless.'
'Don't worry, don't worry. We're not like close\nfriends that live under the same roof. I can help\nher out, though.'
'What? Aoi, did you do something?'
'Well, uh... yeah, I guess so. Don't worry about\nit.'
'If someone tells you not to worry about\nsomething, you're just gonna worry about it more.\nIt's human nature.'
'If Ageha is gonna be like that, I'll do\neverything I can to find out! She's got a network\nthat spreads out like a spider's web!'
'What was that all about, Aoi?'
'Oh, you guys are so annoying.'
However, this means that now Asa and Yoru might\nrun into each other in the classroom.
'C'mon, we've got to get back to the classroom\nquick. See you!'
Kanako then rushed out of the classroom.
I was bummed out, but before going to the club I\nwanted to drop by the first years' classroom.
Yoru said that she would do something, but these\nwere seeds that I had sown.
I couldn't just leave it up to her.
It was a school day, so school finished in the\nmorning.
As soon as we were dismissed, I went directly to\nthe first years' room.
Because I thought if I was too slow, Asa might\nend up going back to the dorm.

It might have been better to go back to the dorm
first so we could discuss things more slowly, but
I just wanted to talk about it as soon as
possible.
I'd made up my mind. This was not the time to\nhesitate.
Hmm?
As I got closer to Asa's classroom, I noticed\nsome kind of commotion.
People were gathered outside of the room, peeking\ninside.
'Hey, what's going on?'
'Looks like a fight, huh?'
...A fight?
'Yeah, those twins are totally fighting. Looks\nlike they were even grappling around a bit.'
No way...!
'That's why they weren't at the club!?'
'I mean, if I went it would just be a nuisance! I\nwould just be a burden to you, and Yoru too.'
'So, that isn't what I would call a\nmisunderstanding!'
Just as I expected, it was Asa and Yoru.
Seems they weren't able to resolve things\nverbally, and they ended up tearing into one\nanother.
'Didn't Aoi turn me down because I was mean to\nyou?!'
'It wasn't like that! That's why Aoi lied! I know\nexactly what happened!'
'I guess he might have lied. But, are you saying\nthat he wasn't?!'
'Then what is it?'
Asa grabbed a hold of Yoru and pulled her close.
'What I'm saying is, you don't have a clue about\nwhat's going on. You always think you understand\neverything.'
'I don't want your sympathy!'
It was useless, Asa was totally in the dark...
For the moment, they just carried on like that.
'Both of you!'
'Aoi, don't try to come between us! Don't say\nanything!'
I tried to say something but they wouldn't let me\nget a word in edgewise.
Most of the other kids were just standing by\nchecking out the show...
Some of the kids were a little freaked out and\nwent to get the teacher, but for the most part\neverybody seemed to enjoy the spectacle.
'Awesome! Yeah, c'mon...!'
'Is there gonna be a cat fight!?'
...Everybody likes a good show.
'I don't really have any sympathy for you. You\ndon't listen to anything anyone says, you just\ncharge on doing whatever you want!'
'You've always been like that, and don't you\nthink I've already put up with way too much of\nit?'
'I do think so!'
Did they just run out of steam or what? For the\nmoment they were just pulled apart.
Even though it didn't really come to the point of\nthrowing blows, both of their faces were flushed\nwith rage. It was pretty nasty.
Anyway, in a few moments both of them had cooled\ndown.
'Yoru, you just don't understand! The way I feel\nor anything!'

'It's hard not being able to do anything about
it. I feel so ashamed. Everything is crashing
down around me, and it's painful just to breathe
'

'You're always so lofty, consoling me with with
your composed attitude! You can do that kind of
thing because you just fly through the sky
without a care in the world!'
'Come on, give it a rest, Asa! All this who's\nhigher and who's lower, I'm not gonna talk about\nthat stuff.'
'You and your complexes. You just arbitrarily\ndecide to hate me, or to envy me.'
'You know it... Sometimes it's like this. You get\nall jealous of me!'
'That's just how it is, we're together. You know\nthat. It's natural isn't it?'
'But it's not like I'm pitying you. I'll say it,\nI think you're really awesome. I respect you. I\nreally do, from the bottom of my heart.'
'I guess that's why I'm always trying to be like\nyou. Well, that's all. Even so, why else would I\nsay something like that?'
Yoru...
Yoru talked to her just like you would a small\nchild. Gently, but yet firm in a way.
'...Me, I'm nothing special... but even you got\nturned down...'
'So that settles it, I was the one who was\nwrong.'
'Asa, your utter lack of self-confidence, somehow\nit's really nice...'
'Because, because...'
'The thing is, Aoi was lying. I know he was. So,\nI think it was definitely my fault...'
'Huh... enough...'
Yoru gasped in amazement.
'Hey, listen... Sis, Aoi isn't like that.\nActually, Aoi likes both of us, that's why he\nturned us down.'
'...What?'
Asa looked at me.
...I just nodded without saying a word.
'Well... Well... why...'

'Because that could end up hurting both of us,
and it might cause some bad blood between us. He
didn't want to see that happen. So he just turned
us both down.'
'It wasn't as if he chose me, and then he wanted\nto keep his distance from you. It wasn't like\nthat.'
'You're such a nice girl. Almost as nice as me, I\nfigure. You give it your all to overcome any\nadversity. That's just the kind of girl you are.'
'That's why Aoi likes you, because you're like\nthat. So if you say that you're no good, isn't\nthat rude to Aoi since he likes you?'
'You can't get overwhelmed by your weakness,\nyou've just got to cheer up. That's what I think,\nanyway.'
'...I'm so sorry, Yoru... I...'
'...Me too, I'm so sorry, sis. '
That was the end of their talk.
The two of them just looked at one another for a\nwhile without saying a word.
The other students around were getting really\ncaught up in the way things were playing out.
'Long story short, that guy was the cause of all\nthis?'
'So this was all about some two-timing!?'
Then, most of the commotion started to come my\nway.
...So, that's what happens.
Once their stories were consolidated, it became\nobvious that I was the cause of it all.
It was hard to be there, I wanted to run.
But to just go and leave the two of them...
'Settle down! You guys! What are you doing\nfighting in the class room, aren't you guys in\nthe glider club?'
Uh, oh. Tobioka-sensei!
The students that had gone to find the teacher\ncame back with Tobioka-sensei.
'You guys are causing trouble again... Anyway,\nstop fighting!'
'Uhhh...'
'It's okay, we already made up.'

'Oh? Well, if everything is fine, why all the
drama here? I think we're going to have to pay a
visit to the Student Guidance Room for a little
counseling...'
'Oh, here we go, sis.'
'That's how it is, Aoi.'
Then, Yoru had a few things to say to me.
In times like this.
'I guess that's how it is, huh Tobioka-sensei?\nBoth of you, let's go.'
I took both of them by the hand and bolted out of\nthe classroom.
'Hey, what do you think you're doing?! Don't you\ndare run in the hall! Hey!'
We just ignored Tobioka-sensei and kept running\non toward the foyer.
'I bet he's gonna be mad at us later.'
'It's alright, isn't it? We really had already\nfinished fighting. The other students were\ncausing most of the commotion.'
'Yeah, I guess you're right. On that note, I was\nthinking we should go on to the club, but Asa's\ncoming too, right?'
'...Sure!'
Yoru's pep talk worked, then. Thankfully, they\nmanaged to come together.

We didn't really talk at all about what happened,
we just went to the secret base without any
discussion and applied ourselves fully to the
club activities.
Every time our eyes met, Asa always looked\nembarrassed and looked away.
Because she knew how I felt now, or maybe she was\njust embarrassed because I had seen the fight\nearlier.
I guess, it was probably a little of both.
But, it wasn't as if everything was neatly\nreconciled, not at all.
Rather, we just reverted back to the state of\nlimbo we were in before.
The only thing I was wrong about was thinking\nthat both of them knew how I felt.
I told them my intentions. They knew how I felt.\nBut...
I still I felt like I needed to check my feelings\nagain, and give them some kind of answer.
...I had no intention of going out with both of\nthem.
I'd already decided not to.
'Asa.'
'Okay.'
'Seems like you really like the sky and birds and\nstuff. I just happened to hear that from my\ngirls.'
'Oh, yeah, well.'
'It's fine to long for something. It's okay to\nfall in love.'
'...What?'
'My name is Kotori.'
'I'm a little bird.'
'Excuse me. Hey, I don't really understand what\nyou're trying to say here...'
'How could you not understand?'
'...tee-hee...'
'Oh, so you laugh at my gag now.'
'Huh? That's not it?'
'Don't lie to me. I saw everything. When you saw\nwhat I was doing, you were snickering, I see how\nyou are.'
'Huh. There's no reason for me to laugh at you.\nBut I always end up laughing.'
'So, I guess you made up with your sister.'
'...Yeah, that's right. Were you worried about\nus?'
'Well, in a way.'
Kanako let out a laugh.
It seems to me, there's no need to worry.
'But I still haven't come to my final decision.\nOnce again, I've got to tell them properly, and\nwrap things up properly.'
'Aoi, you're really faithful to the plot line.\nBut you've also tended to be a little too firm.'
'That sketchy noncommittal attitude is for kids.\nWhatever you do, you should do it properly.'
'That's what makes you so cool. If those kids\nweren't around, I might have fallen in love too.'
'What? What?'
'Whaaaat? I'm joking.'
'...Please, don't play around like that.'
'Ehehe.'
'We made a lot of progress today, huh?'
Just as the sun was setting, someone said the\nword and we ended club activities for the day.
It wasn't something that one person decided, but\nthere was a tacit understanding.
'Let's go ahead and adjourn at this point today.'
'So, Ageha and Kotori. There's something I want\nto buy at Windy today. Would you like to go with\nme?'
'What? I don't really mind, but...'
'Just us?'
'Yeah. I want it to be just girls. But it's kind\nof sad to make Aoi go back all by himself, huh?'
'So... Got it?'
I said that Kanako should be included.
'Are you serious...? Just girls?'
'You don't want Aoi thinking I'm the kind of girl\nthat always wears the same undies, do you?'
'Aoi, do you often see Kanako's underwear?'
'She's always showing me, herself.'
'Nasty...'
'...Fine, Ahega, you also tell her to put on some\nclothes.'
'Haha. Yeah, I guess that's why. Well, I'm gonna\ngo ahead and take the two of them. See you later,\nand you too, Asa, Yoru.'
'Oh yeah, see you.'
'I appreciate all your hard work. See you later.'
Kanako hastily made her preparations to go home\nand left with Kotori and Ageha.
Naturally, the three of us, Asa, Yoru, and I were\nleft alone.
They were sure to make time for me.
'So, let's go back home too.'
We just walked along engulfed in an awkward\nsilence.
It wasn't threatening. Just confusing. I wondered\nwhat I should say.
But I felt like I had to say something. We had to\npick up where we left off with the previous talk.
I think Asa, Yoru, and I were probably all\nthinking the same thing.
The two of them knew how I felt.
And of course, I knew how they felt.
So, now what I had to do was to divide them up\nagain.
Divide them up by telling them how I felt.
'...Okay, Asa, Yoru.'
I stopped and stood right there.
'...Uhhhh.'
The two of them stopped too.
'I...I'm sorry.'
Just as I was about to tell them, I got thrown\noff when Asa interrupted me.
'U-, uh! I've been thinking about it, and I guess\nfirst I should apologize.'
'You know... I caused you so much trouble...'
'No, the trouble is that...'
'I'm so, so, so, sorry about yesterday...!'
'Really.'
'Please, take some time to really think about\nthis.'
'I...guess so...'
'Just because of my petty insecurities, I\nalmost...'
'No that's not true, Asa.'
'Your insecurities aren't petty at all. But the\nthing you did was stupid.'
'Yes. You're right...'
'That's how it is.'
'...I'm really sorry, too.'
'I wish I could've been more perceptive, about my\nsister, and her love as well.'
'And you know, somewhere in my heart, I guess I\ndid feel sorry for you.'
'Because you know, I just hoped that you would\nend up going out with Aoi.'
'Maybe that's why I just played it off so easily.\nNow that I've seen through it, I'll probably just\nbe a burden to you.'
At that point, their words broke off, and silence\nfilled the air.

To be exact, the sounds of cars in the distance
and the whooshing sound of the line of wind
turbines reverberated around us... but it felt as
if all the sound had been sucked out of the
world.
Or maybe time just stopped.
Time and sound just took a rest, waiting for my\nresponse.
'Well...'
I'd made up my mind.
To tell them both once more.
'I like both of you. But, for that reason... I'm\nnot going to go out with either of you.'
'...I'm sorry.'
My answer hadn't changed at all.
'Um, Aoi.'
'What?'
I was prepared to be chastised.
I wouldn't have cared if they blamed me, got\nangry, or even swore at me.
I was prepared for their complaints.
'Well, I have a proposal for you.'
'Proposal...?'
'If it's like that, why don't you just go out\nwith both of us?'
'What?'
'I mean, my sister and I, we both like you.'
'So, If you like both of us then... If that's the\ncase, then I don't think we really have anything\nto worry about.'
'It's alright, you can go out with both of us.'
'What? Uh.. Huh? No, no, no.'
No, wait a minute.
However compelling that may have been...
'Yeah... that sounds good, that way no one loses\nout!'
'No, wait a minute. Why are you agreeing to this,\nAsa!?'
'Because we all really like each other.'
'It just seems like such a waste for everyone to\nignore their feelings...!'
A waste.
She had a point, but is it really such a good\nidea to just respond to human emotions like that?
'No, no matter what it's gonna be a problem. One\nperson going out with two people. In real life,\ntwo-timing just leads to...'
'What's wrong with doubling up?'
'Whaaaaaat!?'
'It's not like I want you all for myself. I just\nwant your love.'
'No, no... Love...'
'To love is to be wounded. People say that the\nonly true drunkenness is to be drunk with love.'
'No, no, no.'
'We've decided to share your love.'
'However, we won't tolerate any flirtation with\nanyone else.'
'So ultimately, you do want me all to\nyourselves.'
I don't know what they thought they were telling\nme about being so open minded.
'Don't you feel lonely that you can't express\nyour feelings?'
'This kind of sharing isn't impossible. Rather,\nit's a rare kind of sharing that we both agree\nto.'
'I want to propose doing it this way since no one\nloses out and everyone can be happy.'
'The way you're talking, it sound like a sales\npitch or something.'
'In that case, I guess you're not on board?'
Yoru...
'I'm really selfish, you know. But I don't want\nto see my sister unhappy. And I want it to be\nthis way for my own sake.'
'If there's any possibility, at least we can try.\nI'd like you to consider it.'
'Please, Aoi. Because we both really like you...'
I realized that they were serious.
They weren't kidding. And they weren't just\ndesperate.
Of course common sense would tell you that\nthere's no way to answer, but they had the gall\nto ask.
'Please, Aoi, for me too.'
'Me too. If it's with Yoru it'll be alright. I\nfeel like we're just bothering you with our\nbegging.'
'We might end up hating each other, I guess,\nbut... But...'
'We like you, Aoi. C'mon, just go out with both\nof us!'
'...Both of you...'
Go out with two people.
Yesterday I was really distraught, but I wasn't\nstraight with them about it.
In my own mind it might have fit into the\nframework of common sense.
But of course,
If Yoru and Asa both agreed to it..
And if they agreed to my response..
But, did I really have the power to make two\npeople happy...?
I was feeling kind of cowardly.
I just girded my loins and told myself: 'You're a\nman, Aoi Minase. This was their idea.
For a man, it's a shame not to partake of such a\ntreat.
If I'm a man, I'll do it.
'I know. I got it.'
'I want to go out with both of you.'
Both of them just smiled from ear to ear.
When I saw that, I felt so relieved that I'd\nanswered the way I did.
'I'm looking forward to it, with both of you.'
I moved closer to the two of them.
'This is like something from a dream.'
I gently embraced the two of them.
...And after that, I ended up going out with both\nof them.
